author: Behzad Aghdashi
description: is a powerful macroscopic freeway analysis tool based on Highway Capacity Manual (HCM). Its unique features include processing speed, software reliability and user friendliness

downloads.title: Download FREEVAL
downloads.description: FREEVAL is a free tool, and all versions in listed in this section can be downloaded from this website. Note that, the HCM base version is also availble at hcmvoume4.org

articles.title: How do I download FREEVAL-WZ or FREEVAL-DSS?
articles.text: FREEVAL+ contains all FREEVAL-WZ and FREEVAL-DSS modules. You can download FREEVAL+ from this website. Once you execute the program, go to "Toolbox Menu" and click on FREEVAL-WZ or FREEVAL-DSS.

articles.title: What are the system requirements for FREEVAL?
articles.text: FREEVAL is written in Java and, therefore, only requires the Java SE Runtime Environment 8 (JRE). Consult the system requirements for the JRE here.

articles.title: How do FREEVAL’s analyses compare to those specified in the Highway Capacity Manual (6th ed.)?
articles.text: FREEVAL replicates the methods of analysis specified in Chapters 10, 11, 12, 13, 14, 25, and 26 of the Highway Capacity Manual (6th ed.).

articles.title: What do I need to do if I have questions or problems using FREEVAL?
articles.text: If you have any problems using FREEVAL, contact support@freeval.org.

articles.title: Can I obtain a customized version of FREEVAL?
articles.text: ITRE can customize FREEVAL to match your specific needs! For example, if you have an in-house data source, FREEVAL can be connected to it. FREEVAL can also be tuned to produce reports according to your organization’s formatting standards. Contact support@freeval.org for a consultation.

resources.text: How to Create and Edit a Facility
Active Traffic and Demand Management Analysis

segmentation.title: FREEVAL-NC Freeway Segmentation Database
segmentation.description: The FREEVAL-NC Freeway Segmentation Database contains geometric and demand information for North Carolina freeways, interstate and non-interstate, which can be imported into the FREEVAL-NC computational engine. It contains the following data:
list: Geometry (segment type, segment length, free flow speed, number of lanes, etc.)

link.text: Go to the FREEVAL-NC Freeway Segmentation Database

title: FREEVAL

training.title: Training
training.description: We provide different types of training for FREEVAL including workshops, classes, webinars etc. We are flexible and open to hold the trainings at your location. Please contact us to discuss your specific needs.

articles.title: Capacity Analysis
articles.text: FREEVAL provides freeway planning-level capacity analyses based on HCM6 for undersaturated and oversaturated conditions.

articles.title: Work Zone Impact Assessment Analysis
articles.text: FREEVAL provides work zone impact assessments based on HCM6 for planning-level and operational-level analyses.

articles.title: Managed Lanes Analysis
articles.text: FREEVAL evaluates the operation of managed lanes such as (HOV, HOT, Express ways) based on HCM6.

articles.title: Travel Time Reliability Analysis
articles.text: FREEVAL assesses the travel time reliability of freeway systems based on the HCM6 reliability scenario generation method.
